Package de.unkrig.lfr.core

Class Sequences

java.lang.Object
de.unkrig.lfr.core.Sequences
public final class Sequences extends Object
Methods that create all kinds of Sequences.

    Sequences.LiteralString
    Representation of a sequence of literal, case-sensitive characters.

      Implements quantifiers (greedy, reluctant and possessive) with minimum quantity zero or one, and infinite maximum quantity.

    • checkQuantified

      protected static void checkQuantified(int offset, de.unkrig.commons.lang.protocol.Consumer<Integer> result, de.unkrig.lfr.core.Sequence operand, int min, int max, de.unkrig.lfr.core.Sequence next, int opminml, int opmaxml)

    • alternatives

      public static de.unkrig.lfr.core.Sequence alternatives(de.unkrig.lfr.core.Sequence[] alternatives)
      Creates and returns Sequence that returns the first match of one alternatives plus this sequence's successor. For example, "a(b|bb)c" will match both "abc" and "abbc". (In the second case, matching "abc" fails, but matching "abbc" eventually succeeds.)
      See Also:
      • independentNonCapturingGroup(Sequence[])

    • independentNonCapturingGroup

      public static de.unkrig.lfr.core.Sequence independentNonCapturingGroup(de.unkrig.lfr.core.Sequence[] alternatives)
      Creates and returns a Sequence that matches the alternatives, and, after the first matching alternative, matches its successor. For example, "a(?>b|bb)c" will match "abc" but not "abbc". (In the second case, matching "ab" succeeds, "abb" is never tried.)

    • capturingGroupStart

      public static de.unkrig.lfr.core.Sequence capturingGroupStart(int groupNumber)
      Implements "(".

    • capturingGroupEnd

      public static de.unkrig.lfr.core.Sequence capturingGroupEnd(int groupNumber)
      Implements ")".

    • beginningOfInput

      public static de.unkrig.lfr.core.Sequence beginningOfInput()
      Implements "^" with !Pattern.MULTILINE, and "\A".

    • beginningOfLine

      public static de.unkrig.lfr.core.Sequence beginningOfLine()

      public static de.unkrig.lfr.core.Sequence endOfInput()
      Implements "$" with !MULTILINE, and "\z".

      Implements "$" with Pattern.MULTILINE.

      Implements "$" with Pattern.MULTILINE and Pattern.UNIX_LINES.

      Implements "\b{g}".

    • wordBoundary

      public static de.unkrig.lfr.core.Sequence wordBoundary()
      Implements "\b", and, negated, "\B".

      Notice that, for compatibility with JUR, this is independant of the Pattern.UNICODE_CHARACTER_CLASSflag!

    • endOfPreviousMatch

      public static de.unkrig.lfr.core.Sequence endOfPreviousMatch()
      Implements "\G".

    • positiveLookahead

      public static de.unkrig.lfr.core.Sequence positiveLookahead(de.unkrig.lfr.core.Sequence op)
      Implements "(?=X)".

    • positiveLookbehind

      public static de.unkrig.lfr.core.Sequence positiveLookbehind(de.unkrig.lfr.core.Sequence op)
      Implements "(?<=X)".

    • greedyQuantifierOnCharacterClass

      public static de.unkrig.lfr.core.Sequence greedyQuantifierOnCharacterClass(CharacterClass operand, int min, int max, int counterNumber)
      Optimized version of greedyOrReluctantQuantifier(Sequence, int, int, int, boolean) when the operand is a bare character class.

      This method, opposed to greedyOrReluctantQuantifier(Sequence, int, int, int, boolean), uses iteration instead of recursion for backtracking and thus saves a considerable number of method calls and call stack depth.

      Parameters:
      min - The "minimum count" of the quantifier
      max - The "maximum count" of the quantifier (may be Integer.MAX_VALUE)

    • greedyQuantifierOnChar

      public static de.unkrig.lfr.core.Sequence greedyQuantifierOnChar(char operand, int min, int max, int counterNumber)
      Optimized version of greedyOrReluctantQuantifier(Sequence, int, int, int, boolean) when the operand is a bare (basic plane) char.

      This method, opposed to greedyOrReluctantQuantifier(Sequence, int, int, int, boolean), uses iteration instead of recursion for backtracking and thus saves a considerable number of method calls and call stack depth.

      Parameters:
      min - The "minimum count" of the quantifier
      max - The "maximum count" of the quantifier (may be Integer.MAX_VALUE)

    • reluctantQuantifierOnCharacterClass

      public static de.unkrig.lfr.core.Sequence reluctantQuantifierOnCharacterClass(CharacterClass operand, int min, int max, int counterNumber)
      Optimized version of greedyOrReluctantQuantifier(Sequence, int, int, int, boolean) when the operand is a bare character class.

      This method, opposed to greedyOrReluctantQuantifier(Sequence, int, int, int, boolean), uses iteration instead of recursion for backtracking and thus saves a considerable number of method calls and call stack depth.

      Parameters:
      min - The "minimum count" of the quantifier
      max - The "maximum count" of the quantifier (may be Integer.MAX_VALUE)

    • reluctantQuantifierOnChar

      public static de.unkrig.lfr.core.Sequence reluctantQuantifierOnChar(char operand, int min, int max, int counterNumber)
      Optimized version of reluctantQuantifierOnCharacterClass(CharacterClass, int, int, int) when the operand is a bare (basic plane) char.

      This method, opposed to greedyOrReluctantQuantifier(Sequence, int, int, int, boolean), uses iteration instead of recursion for backtracking and thus saves a considerable number of method calls and call stack depth.

      Parameters:
      min - The "minimum count" of the quantifier
      max - The "maximum count" of the quantifier (may be Integer.MAX_VALUE)

    • greedyQuantifierOnAnyCharAndLiteralString

      public static de.unkrig.lfr.core.Sequence greedyQuantifierOnAnyCharAndLiteralString(int min, int max, CharSequence ls)
      Implements a greedy quantifier on an "any char" operand, followed by a literal String.

      Examples: ".*ABC" ".{3,17}ABC"

      Parameters:
      min - The "minimum count" of the quantifier
      max - The "maximum count" of the quantifier (may be Integer.MAX_VALUE)

    • reluctantQuantifierOnAnyCharAndLiteralString

      public static de.unkrig.lfr.core.CompositeSequence reluctantQuantifierOnAnyCharAndLiteralString(int min, int max, CharSequence ls)
      Implements a reluctant quantifier on an "any char" operand, followed by a literal String.

      Examples: ".*?ABC" ".{3,17}?ABC"

      Parameters:
      min - The "minimum count" of the quantifier
      max - The "maximum count" of the quantifier (may be Integer.MAX_VALUE)

    • negate

      public static de.unkrig.lfr.core.Sequence negate(de.unkrig.lfr.core.Sequence op)
      Creates and returns a sequence that produces a zero-width match iff the op does not match, and otherwise (iff the op does match) does not match.
